title: 109_hr5939
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" and includes provisions related to terrorist offenses resulting in death. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" amends Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code, by adding a new section, Sec. 2339E, which addresses terrorist offenses resulting in death. It states that anyone who causes the death of a person while committing a terrorist offense shall face the death penalty or life imprisonment. The term 'terrorist offense' is defined as a felony offense that falls under specific criteria outlined in the section. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" adds a new section to Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code, addressing terrorist offenses resulting in death. It specifies that causing death during a terrorist offense can lead to the death penalty or life imprisonment. The section lists specific felony offenses that qualify as terrorist offenses. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces the death penalty for certain terrorist offenses resulting in death. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces the death penalty for specific terrorist offenses resulting in death, including participation in nuclear and weapons of mass destruction threats, missile systems to destroy aircraft, atomic weapons, and radiological dispersal devices. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces the death penalty for specific terrorist offenses resulting in death, including participation in nuclear and weapons of mass destruction threats, missile systems to destroy aircraft, atomic weapons, and radiological dispersal devices. Sections of the United States Code are amended to include "death or" before "imprisonment for life" for certain offenses. SEC. 4 of the "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" increases penalties for specific offenses by amending Section 2332(b)(1), Section 2332(c), and Section 2339C(d) of title 18, United States Code. The amendments include increasing imprisonment terms from 20 years to 30 years and from 10 years to 20 years for certain offenses. SEC. 5 amends Section 2339C by replacing "unlawfully and wilfully" with "knowingly." SEC. 6 addresses providing material support to terrorist groups. SEC. 6 amends penalties for providing material support to terrorist groups under Section 2339A(a) and receiving military-type training under Section 2339D of title 18, United States Code. Penalties now include imprisonment for not less than 10 years or for life, and up to 30 years or life if death results. SEC. 7. DENIAL OF FEDERAL BENEFITS TO CONVICTED TERRORISTS. The amendment to Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code, introduces a new section denying Federal benefits to individuals convicted of a Federal crime of terrorism. This includes being ineligible for any or all Federal benefits for a specified term or for life. The amendment to Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code defines 'benefit' and includes a Table of Sections Amendment. SEC. 8. Amends Section 2516(q) of title 18, US Code by replacing references to specific sections with "chapter 113B".

SEC. 9. Amends Section 2339D of title 18, US Code to include attempts or conspiracies to receive military training benefits.
